result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Barksdale

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Barksdale in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Brandon Barksdale.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed the community service hours. In order to receive the benefits of the agreement, the defendant needs to continue to comply with the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Community Service Verification

Defendant Brandon Barksdale in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3:  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Barksdale in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Obscherning requests a DPA hearing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon Barksdale in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has received discovery and an offer.  The defendant is going to scheduled a TAD evaluation and defense requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with ****
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with P.F.J. and G.L.

Defendant Brandon Barksdale in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Brandon Barksdale in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Barksdale appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
